3. Trafficking in persons.{1) Any person who recruits, harbours,
transports, provides or obtains another person, or affempts to do so, for
compelled labour or commercial sex acts through the use of force, fraud or
coercion, commits an offence of trafficking in persons and shall be punished with
irnprisonment which may extend to seven years or with fine which rnay extend to
one million rupees or with both.
(2) If the offence of trafficking in persons under sub-section (1) is
committed against a child or a woman, the person who commits the offence shall
be punished with imprisonment which may extend to ten years and which shall
not be less than two years or with fine which may extend to one rnillion rupees or
with both.

5. Abetment and criminal conspiracy.{l) Any person who
participates as an accomplice, aids, or abets an offence under section 3 or section 4,
shall be punished in accordance with Chapter V ofthe Penal Code'
(2) Any person who is a party to a criminal conspiracy to commit an
offence under section 3 or section 4, shall be punished in accordance with

6. Victims of traflicking in persons.-A victim shall not be criminally

7. Presumption in case of child victim.-Where the victim is a child,
the prosecution may not prove actual use of force, fraud or coercion and the Court
may not consider the consent ofthd victim, his parent or guardian as a defence.
8. Investigating agency.-{ I ) Subject to sub-section (2). the police
shall investigate an offence under this Ordinance.
(2) If the offence involves transportation of the victim into or our of
Pakistan and it constitutes part of the transaction constituting the offence, the
Federal Investigation Agency shall investigate the offence.
9. Cognizance.-An offence under this Ordinance shalf be cognizable
and non-bailable under thc Codc.
10. Cognizance of offences.-Notwithstanding.anything contained in
the Code, a Magistrate of the First Class shall try an offence punishable under
this Ordinance and may impose any punishment provided under the Ordinance.
I l. Spfety of victims and witnesses of offences. {l) The Federal
Govemment or a Provincial Govemment may, in the prescribed manner, take
appropriate measures to ensure that a victim, witness of an offence under this
Ordinance or any other related person is provided adequate protection if safety ofthe
victim. witness or the person is at risk.
(2) When it is necessary to safeguard the physical safety of a victim or
witness of an offence under this Ordinance, the Federal Governmenl or a
Provincial Covernment may, in the prescribed rnanner, take necessary tneasures
to relocate victim or witness or to limit the disclosure of name of the victim or
witness, address and other identifying personal information or both.
